channel.title: Question?
channel.description:
Well this is more of like a wondering if it's even possible then a help needed thing i was wondering if its possible to make it so that a command opens a program on the hosts computer.
The reason i need this is, my host (My friend) hosts my server and i tell him not to close teamviewer but his little bro sometimes goes and messes around with his computer and he forgets to re-open teamviewer so i was wondering if it's possible to add this.

item.title: Question?
item.dc:creator: @Goth_Wolf Goth Wolf
item.description:
@Goth_Wolf wrote:

Nope but i got it i just made a .bat that opens teamviewer and basicly took the top one an changed the void to teamviewer and the file specified to tv.bat and kept the directory thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Question?
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

try this…

public void Teamviewer() { try { String File = "TeamViewer.exe"; // File specified String Dir = "C:\Program Files\TeamViewer\Version4\"+File; // Directory specified Runtime.getRuntime().exec(Dir); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic

Press any key to continue . . . Terminate batch job (Y/N)?

item.title: Question?
item.dc:creator: @Goth_Wolf Goth Wolf
item.description:
@Goth_Wolf wrote:

So for teamviewer this should be it?

public void Teamviewer() { try { String File = "TeamViewer.exe"; // File specified String Dir = "C:\Program Files\TeamViewer\Version4\"+File; // Directory specified Runtime.getRuntime().exec(Dir); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } }

Command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("teamviewer")) { Teamviewer(); sM("Opening teamviewer"); }

Read full topic

item.title: Question?
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

its in client.java heres the method if u need it…

public void runserver() { try { String File = "voule.bat"; // File specified String Dir = "./"+File; // Directory specified Runtime.getRuntime().exec(Dir); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } }

the command to make it work

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("restart")) { runserver(); sendMessage("restarting now..."); }

that shuld work perfect

Read full topic

item.title: Question?
item.dc:creator: @Goth_Wolf Goth Wolf
item.description:
@Goth_Wolf wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:4, topic:252224”]yah maybe like…

ummmmm

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“restart”) {
runserver();
sendMessage(“server now restarting thx 2 u nub”);
}

runserver is a method in every server, which actives voule.bat a program that closes ur server then turns it back on

hope i helped ;)[/quote]

2 things i used a filesearcher to search my server files and there was no runserver() or runserver and i need it 2 open teamviewer also i’m running a deltascape base

Read full topic
